TopicTitle: Video Wednesdays: S K Y: A GoPro Kerbal Cinematic

Articles.Content:
<p><img src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/87dda5f22121633ebc5ff4dc817129a6/tumblr_inline_ndvd9rUdTx1rr2wit.jpg"/></p>

<p><iframe frameborder="0" height="315" src="//www.youtube.com/embed/mpQbEuEXN2U" width="420"></iframe></p>

<p><strong>UpsilonAerospace</strong> combined the usual goodness of a KSP cinematic with real life GoPro footage to make a unique, well crafted video that makes the best of both worlds.</p>
Wow! That is really a creative idea!

Thank you guys so much!! I had a lot of fun making this

Let me know if you have any questions about the rocket... I'll try to answer them the best I can.

Well deserved again.

I like this launch too!

Though the music wasn't created by you . Still great though.

Edited October 23, 2014 by Avera9eJoe

Well deserved again.

I like this launch too!

Though the music wasn't created by you . Still great though.

True, true. And while we're walking down memory lane, I suppose we can go way back.

After I posted the second video, there was a comment that was something along the lines of "This is all well and good, but M83's Outro is way, way overused..." and so I never used it again. Now, I'm proud to use my own music! Because why not.

Thanks for the kind words sir!
Really good videos. I enjoy model rocketry and using a GoPro, but I've never used them together. Looks fun.

Excellent video.

Most "annoying" background music ever though, I mean not the composition but the frequency used almost made my head explode.

First one was nice.

Edited October 23, 2014 by Athlonic

True, true. And while we're walking down memory lane, I suppose we can go way back.

After I posted the second video, there was a comment that was something along the lines of "This is all well and good, but M83's Outro is way, way overused..." and so I never used it again. Now, I'm proud to use my own music! Because why not.

Thanks for the kind words sir!

I haven't seen that video! Cool to see a rocket launch in the winter. When I was a cub scout I launched rocks in small sulfur rockets and called it moon rock! I also remember launching a sugar packet and then eating is as "space sugar" too!

So THAT'S what that song is called. Thanks for clearing that up xD. Thanks a ton. Oh and as to your PM, I think I'll experiment with your "lift rating asymmetrical beast plane idea" because building those kinds of things are fun xD.
Did you use a kit for the rocket or is it homemade? Nice video btw!

I really love model rockets. Gonna build a couple of them this weekend, as a matter of fact!

Our school is doing a physics "festival" where we had to divide into groups and choose a project. Naturally, our group (we're four in total) instantly chose rockets. We'll be buying three kilograms of Kno3 and two of Sugar, just so we can do some burn tests before assembling the two rockets we'll take to the festival -each will weight less than 1kg total -. It'll be Kerbal rocketry at its finest. There's no calculations, no parachute, and no experience. And there's two possible outcomes:

1) boom.

2) whoosh.

We'll be taking lots of caution with this project (we're making rockets after all), and our physics teacher said the school will be responsible for anything that gets broken. Don't want to end up with burnt faces.

Really good videos. I enjoy model rocketry and using a GoPro, but I've never used them together. Looks fun.

You can get incredible footage. Just be sure that the camera is stuck on there pretty well (so that it doesn't fall off) and that the rocket can lift it without arcing over to the side and crashing.

Excellent video.

Most "annoying" background music ever though, I mean not the composition but the frequency used almost made my head explode.

First one was nice.

H'm. That wasn't intentional, but it may explain some of the 'Dislikes' that the video has been getting on my channel. Sorry for any head explosions that this video causes.

I haven't seen that video! Cool to see a rocket launch in the winter. When I was a cub scout I launched rocks in small sulfur rockets and called it moon rock! I also remember launching a sugar packet and then eating is as "space sugar" too!

So THAT'S what that song is called. Thanks for clearing that up xD. Thanks a ton. Oh and as to your PM, I think I'll experiment with your "lift rating asymmetrical beast plane idea" because building those kinds of things are fun xD.

I had my fair share of cute little tiny payloads, in my day. I still fly a little plastic pig in a rocket called the "Swine Flew!" Yes, these puns are terrible. I'm so sorry.

Good luck with the asymmetrical terrifying plane of death! Don't forget that you need all of the Mk2 parts (including the cargo bays and the cockpits). I look forward to seeing the monstrosity.

Did you use a kit for the rocket or is it homemade? Nice video btw!

The rocket was actually this one. It's not too large, but it was able to loft a GoPro nicely. (While I did follow the kit's instructions, I had to build a separate section on top for the GoPro.)

I really love model rockets. Gonna build a couple of them this weekend, as a matter of fact!

Our school is doing a physics "festival" where we had to divide into groups and choose a project. Naturally, our group (we're four in total) instantly chose rockets. We'll be buying three kilograms of Kno3 and two of Sugar, just so we can do some burn tests before assembling the two rockets we'll take to the festival -each will weight less than 1kg total -. It'll be Kerbal rocketry at its finest. There's no calculations, no parachute, and no experience. And there's two possible outcomes:

1) boom.

2) whoosh.

We'll be taking lots of caution with this project (we're making rockets after all), and our physics teacher said the school will be responsible for anything that gets broken. Don't want to end up with burnt faces.

Best of luck. You'll need it, a little... KNO3 rockets are notorious for doing whatever they want. Hopefully, you can corral them skywards and watch them whoosh into the heavens! (Also, I've found that with a lack of parachutes, the rocket is sometimes still burning when it hits the ground. Be sure to bring fire extinguishers, please.)

I bet you thought I couldn't make cinematics...! Well, I'm no Nassault or HatBat, but I can hold my own, I think.

You can certainly hold your own, and your ability to create your own custom music for cinematics is invaluable. Very good work

You can certainly hold your own, and your ability to create your own custom music for cinematics is invaluable. Very good work

Thanks! And I hope you appreciated the little plug, there
I love the music very mass effect-ish!

Love it. Any chance we could get some views of the GoPro mount setup you used? I'm a VFX artist and can think of at least 30 different times that I could have saved myself hours and even days of work by simply having a GoPro mounted on a model rocket. I'm familiar with 3D modelling and 3D printing (already printed a couple different rockets just for fun) and would love to be able to make a new 3D printed rocket with some sort of GoPro mount built into the nose cone assembly.
